content.description: To the right of Webber Seam is a featured wall with several V0s. The climbing is unique at Whiskey in that it consists almost entirely of slopers and pinches. Great way to warm up. The best line follows a groove on the right side of the wall, but harder problems and eliminates exist.
content.location: Just around the corner from Webber Seam. Obvious featured face. Downclimb to the right.

content.description: Climbs the arete left of Webber Seam. The moves are nice but the line is short and the landing is poor, so this isn't quite a classic. Start standing with the left hand pinching the arete, right hand on a sidepull, and a very poor foot. Move up to a bad right hand crimp then make a long move left into the sloping vertical groove. One or two moves lead to a topout jug.
content.protection: Several pads and spotters. Though the problem isn't high, the landing is a rather steep slope with a sharp rock at the bottom.
content.location: The sharp arete just left of Webber Seam.

content.description:
The classic area moderate. A striking, obvious line up a seam in the center of the freestanding Webber boulder. 

  Start matched on a thin undercling with good feet. Move left to the seam. Crimp and sidepull up until you can grab a perfect quartz crystal crimp on the face to the right of the seam. With poor feet, make a long move to the lip and ultimately to the jug 6" behind the lip. Top out with ease.
content.protection: Several pads. There is a sharp, jutting rock just behind the landing zone, and a fall from the last move will likely send you right onto it.
content.location: Located off the ridge proper, down and to the right as you enter the Entrance Area. The problem is on a large, square, freestanding boulder about 50 yards down the hill.

content.description: Stolen Delights tackles the corner to the right of Webber Seam. Beginning at the undercling on the face left of the arete (same start as W. Seam), move right around the corner to a jug on the rail. Post feet and stand up hard into a bad left hand undercling. With the right hand, slap up a good vertical groove until you can reach a jug out left. Top out and walk off.
content.protection: Pad or two. Slightly high, but the landing's fine.
content.location: On the right side of the Webber Boulder, just right of Webber Seam.

content.description: This freestanding boulder is home to some fine moderates, including the classic Webber Seam. Visiting this boulder is a must while at Whiskey.
